ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: carrying goblets and decanters and a cup from a flowing spring -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Cups and decanters, beakers full of sparkling wine,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: with goblets and ewers and a cup filled with a drink drawn from a running spring,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: with goblets, jugs and cups of crystal clear wine
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Carrying bowls and pitchers – and cups filled with wine flowing before them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: With cups, and jugs, and a glass of flowing wine,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: With goblets and ewers and a cup of pure drink;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: with goblets, and ewers, and a cup from a spring
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: With bowls and ewers and a cup from a pure spring
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: carrying goblets and ewers and cups filled with the purest wine,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: With goblets and ewers and a cup of limpid drink.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: with goblets and ewers and a cup of a clear wine,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: With cups, and jugs, and a glass from the flowing wine,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: with goblets and ewers, and a cup from a spring
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: With cups, pitchers, and sparkling drinks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:18] with goblets (akwāb are drinking-vessels without handles) and ewers (abārīq [are vessels that] have handles and spouts) and a cup (ka’s is the vessel for drinking wine) from a flowing spring, in other words, wine flowing from a spring that never runs out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: The youth will go round (With bowls and ewers and a cup from a pure spring) of pure running wine
